into visually intresting,
a keen eye for coordination with design I'm here.

aboutMe.title: About me
aboutMe.description:
I began my journey as a test engineer, where I gained experience in various types of testing, such as unit testing, end-to-end testing, and integration testing. These experiences helped me develop a keen eye for detail and an understanding of what is important for end users. These experiences helped me develop a keen eye for details and also what is important for End users.
As I delved deeper into frontend development, React and Vue.js sparked my interest. In my first frontend developer role, I crafted over 20 pages for both mobile and desktop displays using Vue.js, SASS, BEM, and Bootstrap-Vue. Later, I developed a dashboard for an online payment company using React, TypeScript, Styled-Components, Tailwind, and Figma. Throughout my career, I've collaborated with numerous teams in environments that employed Agile methodologies and Scrum.
To expand my React skills, I participated in Meta's Front-End Developer Certificate program, which was incredibly helpful and deepened my knowledge of Figma and other tools.
I firmly believe that while tools are important, maintaining a passion for learning is even more crucial. This enthusiasm not only contributes to the growth of companies but also to the development of individual developers.

zibal.name: Zibal
zibal.description:
Zibal is an online payment company offering financial and payment solutions for businesses of all sizes. As part of Zibal's dashboard project, I contributed to creating dashboards that allow end users to monitor the status of financial transactions and generate reports.
I was responsible for developing and maintaining the frontend dashboard, working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and a user-friendly interface.
By conducting code reviews and troubleshooting, I promoted a culture of high-quality code and continuous improvement.
The team comprised one DevOps engineer, three backend developers, one Scrum Master, and one QA specialist.
zibal.skills: React - TypeScript - Styled-component - tailwind - CSS - HTML - Axios - GitHub - Figma - Scrum

Lastsecond.name: Lastsecond
Lastsecond.description:
Lastsecond is a website focused on travel and tourism in Iran. I worked as a front-end developer at LastSecond.ir, a Persian hotel and flight reservation website. My responsibilities included refactoring the company's website from an outdated framework to a new one that utilized Vue.js and Sass. The main aim was to create a mobile and desktop-friendly design. I had to rewrite the main pages for tours, hotels, flights, itineraries, blogs, restaurants, videos, and attractions.

To ensure the project aligned with the objectives, I collaborated effectively with backend developers, UI/UX designers, and the product manager. This involved clear and consistent communication throughout the process.
Lastsecond.skills: Vue.js - Bootstrap-Vue - Bootstrap - HTML - Javasciprt - SASS - Linux - GitLab - Zeplin - Scrum

Chargoon.name: Chargoon
Chargoon.description:
Chargoon is a major platform in the human resources community. During my journey as a Manual QA Engineer at Chargoon, a company that offers office automation solutions, human resources, finance, and other e-commerce tools.
I was responsible for testing three distinct platforms: the Contract and Salary Platform, the Organization Platform, and the Employment Platform.
TFS was effectively utilized to create, test, and communicate bugs with the development team.

As a QA, I performed unit testing on each feature as well as end-to-end testing.
Also I collaborated with a team of over 10 developers, 3 Scrum masters, and 2 test engineers to ensure that testing processes were efficient and seamless.
Chargoon.skills: TFS - Unit testing - End to End testing - Integration test - Scrum
